Italy: Valentinian III was assassinated on orders of the senator Petronius Maximus. The Senate acclaimed Maximus augustus of the Western Roman Empire. Maximus was killed by a mob as he attempted to flee Rome in the face of a Vandal advance. Sack of Rome (455): The Vandals entered and began to sack Rome. The Magister militum Avitus was pronounced augustus of the Western Roman Empire at Toulouse by the Visigothic king Theodoric II.
